1114867167437176832.text:
Every odd integer is the difference of 2 squares
Proof:
1) Pick an odd number
░░ ░░ ░░ ░░ ░░

2) Bend it in half
░░ ░░ ░░
░░
░░

3) Fill in the rest
░░ ░░ ░░
░░ ▓▓ ▓▓
░░ ▓▓ ▓▓

The odd nbr is the area difference of the big and small squares

This isn’t a problem that can be solved by adding more developers or, more dramatically, replacing your existing developers. It’s called technical debt because, at some point, it needs to be paid down.

Paying down technical debt keeps you competitive. It keeps you in the game.

1105049518662447104.text:
“All code has technical debt. That’s normal. You can keep playing Tetris with a few gaps.”

“Too much technical debt will prevent features and bug fixes from shipping in a reasonable amount of time.”

1105049517940981760.text:
"Often, the business needs (new features, new products) will lead to tradeoffs within the code (hacks, shortcuts) in order to ship on time."

“Scenarios like these create technical debt within the product code. A buried gap in Tetris represents technical debt.”

1097882643394453505.text: Communicating a complex idea in simple terms to a non-technical audience is not easy but it is great to get everyone on the same page and make for more efficient teams. This may be the most valuable skillset in tech!

1097882642714976259.text: I've definitely fallen into this trap of complaining about the business side not understanding the tech but doing nothing to really go after the root of the problem...

1097882641922170880.text: “Too often developers complain that “the business” knows nothing about technology and don’t know how to work with developers effectively. Does complaining solve the problem? No. Someone has to take full responsibility over the problem and fix it. Guess who is that?"

#tidyingup

1093554832408002562.text: So if internal processes don't reflect improving UX, then it's the internal processes that should change and not the other way around!

1093554831695007744.text: But what often sparks joy for software teams is to ship new features, many times because compensation and promotions are tied to pushing new things out. But it's important to remember that software is built for the sake of users (like Amazon's creed to "delight your customers"),

1093554831011340288.text: I also think a lot of the Tidying Up concepts transfer readily to the tech world. More often than not, I think existing users are happy with tech offerings but would prefer to have more streamlined and bug-free experiences (in effect, they would prefer the apps to be tidied up)

1093554830352793600.text: Like a lot of folks out there, I've really enjoyed Marie Kondo's Netflix show Tidying Up on decluttering. I'm currently in the process of going through my wardrobe... Looking at old clothes that used to fit me definitely doesn't spark joy, so I thank them and am giving them away!

1070150676246867968.text:
Anyway, just wanted to put this out there. If anyone has a shared experience, feel free to share it and/or any tips that work for you :)

We're all in this together!

1070150675361906688.text: So long story short: I have a lot of work to get caught up on! I think I'm pretty close to 100% now so if I haven't gotten back to you recently, I look to be responding soon

1070150674502037505.text: I think my episode was brought on by a combination of things but one that I've been neglecting with fully remote work is the importance of face-to-face interaction. From now on I will be making an effort to get outside the house and hit up coffee shops, WeWorks, events, etc.

1070150673361195008.text:
I've been chatting with people privately and was surprised to see that quite a few others had been in the same boat and were able to provide some nice tips and tricks to help manage. Just wish I had reached out sooner! 

Depression tends to isolate, gotta break down them walls

1070150672430047232.text:
Good news is I'm on the upswing after making some changes to medication and other things (more on that in a bit!)

I wanted to share this info publicly to help open the dialogue about mental health :)

1070150671389863936.text: Hey all, I wanted to provide a quick update on why it's been tougher to reach me during the past few weeks. At the risk of oversharing, I have bipolar disorder and found myself in a pretty nasty major depressive episode for most of November... My productivity took a nosedive :/
